show.title: The Blair Witch Project
show.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT

event.title: <show-title>The Blair Witch Project</show-title>
event.headline: Before CLOVERFIELD, there was...THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT
event.description:
In October 1994, three student filmmakers disappeared in the woods near Burkittsville, Maryland, to make a documentary about the mythical Blair Witch. What starts off as a straightforward piece slowly becomes more and more mysterious and terrifying. Soon the filmmakers care more about finding their way out of the woods than making a film... A year later, their footage was found.

For better or worse, THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT has become one of ‚Äì if not the most ‚Äì influential modern horror films. Its simplistic premise and found-footage technique (or gimmick, depending on who you ask) have had countless imposters over the last 15 years, but none of them have come close to achieving the effectiveness that BLAIR WITCH encompasses. Famously shot for $60,000, the film made a staggering, game-changing $250 million worldwide at the box office and became a phenomenon. What seems to have gotten lost over the years is that this is still a first-rate horror film.

event.headline: Party like a dragon warrior
event.description: How can you possibly make KUNG FU PANDA 4 even more fun? Add games, crafts, and fun props for the whole family at our Family Party screening. Skadoosh! Walk the warrior‚Äôs path with kung fu headbands, chopsticks, LED dragon puppets, and crafting your very own paper lanterns. Plus, all that fun is easily the best way to find inner peace. Your ticket includes the movie, the activities, and the props. Be sure to arrive up to 30 minutes early to give yourself plenty of time to get in on the fun.

show.title: The Woman Chaser
show.headline: Turn of the century underground neo-noir at its finest.

event.title: <show-title>The Woman Chaser</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Turn of the century underground neo-noir at its finest.
event.description:
Intro and Q&A with star Patrick Warburton, producer Joe McSpadden, and writer/director Robinson Devor.

Adapted from the shaggy dog prose of pulp novelist Charles Willeford (COCKFIGHTER, MIAMI BLUES), THE WOMAN CHASER stars Patrick Warburton as a down-on-his-luck used car salesman in the City of Angels. He ambles through life in a booze-soaked haze as he scrabbles together enough cash to fund a low-budget opus that'll have his name in lights. An arch neo-noir that can feel like the Coen Bros. adapting a Daniel Clowes comic, you may not have seen THE WOMAN CHASER before, but you sure as hell won't forget it. (Jake Isgar)

35mm original release print courtesy of filmmaker Robinson Devor

show.title: Pulp Fiction
show.headline: "You know what they call a Quarter Pounder with cheese in Paris?"

event.title: <show-title>Pulp Fiction</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do the twist at our PULP FICTION Movie Party
event.description:
PULP FICTION shook audiences around the world when it first arrived 30 years ago, lifting elements from a wide array of time-worn stories and weaving them together into something truly new. Considering its impact on film history and just how damn watchable it is, any time is a great time to celebrate this iconic achievement.

When you arrive we'll provide you with an ‚Äúadrenaline‚Äù shot pen in case you need a shot to the heart, candy cigarettes (just pretend they're Red Apple band), and a yellow coffee mug so you can enjoy some "serious gourmet sh*t" just like Jules.

So don‚Äôt be a square, daddio. Grab your honey bunny and cruise on down to the most fun, most bloody, most groovy Movie Party in town.

show.title: Happy Gilmore
show.headline: Adam Sandler doesn't play golf. He destroys it.

event.title: <show-title>Happy Gilmore</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Just tap it in at the happiest movie party we've ever thrown
event.description:
Grab your grandma‚Äôs clubs and join us at an interactive screening celebrating the only guy to ever take his skates off and try to stab somebody ‚Äì HAPPY GILMORE. He was the likable, rage-fueled everyman we needed to take on the Shooter McGavins of the world, winning tournaments and our hearts with one mighty swing of his club. It‚Äôs easily one of Adam Sandler‚Äôs funniest, most quotable movies ever (and that‚Äôs saying something), and if you disagree, you‚Äôre welcome to a warm glass of shut-the-hell-up.

Will there be interactive fun and themed props? Did Grizzly Adamas have a beard? He did, and you can definitely count on a memorable time with foam hockey sticks, golf tees, and golf ball lip balm. Bonus points if you wear your gold jacket.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
show.headline: The next chapter begins

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: New Moon</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say hello to Jacob's biceps in this lovesick interactive screening
event.description:
No need to throw yourself off a cliff hoping to get a glimpse of Movie Party fun, because we‚Äôre back from Italy with another interactive TWILIGHT screening.

It‚Äôs a whole NEW MOON this time around. Edward‚Äôs gone, Jacob hit puberty in a big way, and Bella has a serious case of separation anxiety. The only thing that hasn‚Äôt changed is how much fun you‚Äôll have. You give us everything we need just by breathing, but we‚Äôre giving all of you some themed gifts like BWTHHYBL bumper stickers, mini desk calendars, and custom bandaids. Be sure to keep that last one handy for papercuts at family gatherings.

So whether you‚Äôre Team Edward or Team Jacob, hop on your motorcycle and join us for another adventure in Forks that‚Äôs...kind of beautiful.

show.title: The Taste of Things
show.headline: A captivating feast from award-winning director Anh Hung Tran

event.title: <show-title>The Taste of Things</show-title> <event-type-title>Feast</event-type-title>
event.headline: You're invited for a four-course French feast
event.description:
Writer/director Anh Hung Tran‚Äôs captivating story of love in the French countryside is gorgeous, romantic, and filled with some of the most delicious-looking shots of food ever put to film. We couldn‚Äôt just let you sit through all that without a proper meal, so we‚Äôre throwing an exclusive THE TASTE OF THINGS Feast screening. Join us for a four-course prix fixe menu of French staples complete with wine pairings. While we can‚Äôt guarantee that you‚Äôll find true love with the cook, we can confidently say that you won‚Äôt go hungry.

Seating will be extremely limited, so be sure to reserve your seats as soon as you can. Please note that while vegetarian options will be available, we cannot accommodate vegan, gluten-free, or dairy-free.

event.title: <show-title>Twilight (2008)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say the name of this impossibly fun & interactive screening out loud‚Ä¶Movie Party
event.description:
You better hold on tight, spider monkey, because we‚Äôve got an interactive screening for you that shines brighter than Edward‚Äôs skin on a sunny day.

While that might be the skin of a killer, it‚Äôs the face that launched a thousand fans, and we‚Äôre bringing as many as we can together for our TWILIGHT Movie Party. Not only will it feature Edward‚Äôs steely charisma and maybe the best baseball scene ever put to film, it‚Äôll have themed props like blood vials (mini ketchup bottles), TITSOAK sunglasses to let everyone know that you have the skin of a killer, and vampire teeth that you‚Äôll fall unconditionally and irrevocably in love with.

So start working on your tan, book a flight to Forks, and join us for a night of bloodthirsty fun you‚Äôll remember for the next 100 years of being 17.

show.title: In the Mood for Love
show.headline: Wong Kar-Wai's mesmerizing tale of love never realized

landscapeHeroImage.altText: In the mood for love sp hero

portraitHeroImage.altText: In the mood for love sp hero

posterImages.altText: In the mood for love poster

event.title: <show-title>In the Mood for Love</show-title>
event.headline: Wong Kar-Wai mesmerizing tale of love never realized.
event.description:
‚ÄúHe remembers those vanished years. As though looking through a dusty window pane, the past is something he could see, but not touch. And everything he sees is blurred and indistinct.‚Äù

If my life was a movie, I would want it to be a Wong Kar-wai film. Not because they're particularly happy, but damn, all the sad shit that happens will be exceptionally alluring and grand. Maybe, I just want immaculately tailored garments and a killer score? ANYWHO, I digress. Dreamy, surreal, and achingly beautiful, Wong Kar-wai‚Äôs 2000 period drama IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is quite simply one of the most romantic films ever made. In 1962 British Hong Kong, neighbors Chow Mo-wan (Tony Leung) and Su Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) begin to develop an intimate companionship after they realize their respective spouses are having an affair. Will they surrender to their desire and loneliness? Or will they spend several years longingly glancing at each other during beautiful slow-motion shots? There‚Äôs nothing queerer than lingering repression and yearning, y‚Äôall. Dripping with aesthetic drama and gorgeous cinematography, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is a film that demands watching on the biggest screen possible. If you‚Äôve never seen this film DON‚ÄôT PANIC because now‚Äôs your chance, but remember, if you miss this opportunity, you might just spend the rest of your life wondering what might have been.

4k DCP courtesy of Janus Films.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Crow (1994)
show.headline: In a world without justice, he was chosen to protect the innocent

event.title: <show-title>The Crow (1994)</show-title>
event.headline: ‚ÄúBuildings burn, people die, but real love is forever.‚Äù
event.description:
When I was a little nine-year-old queer child, I dressed up as Eric Draven from THE CROW for Halloween. I was deeply obsessed with the dark and fucked up world of Alex Proyas‚Äôs 1994 film after seeing it in theaters over the summer, and THE CROW was the only costume I could imagine wearing that fall. So with my mom‚Äôs help and a shit ton of pancake makeup, I made my transformation into the dark avenger of Detroit. Looking back at photos of this night, it didn‚Äôt work out. I just ended up looking like Ace Frehley from KISS‚Ä¶but I felt like THE CROW and it was sublime.

One year after the violent murder of rock musician Eric Draven and his girlfriend Shelley Webster, Draven returns from the dead with the aid of a mystical crow. Sure, definitely. That makes sense. The undead revenant paints his face like a nightmare Peirott, throws on a black leather duster, and launches into a blood-soaked mission of vengeance against those who harmed him and his loved ones. Oh yeah, and he‚Äôs also got a butch little moppet who he has to protect along the way. Grungy, grim, and ridiculously rainy, THE CROW was a dream come true for every mid-'90s mall goth and little queer weirdo. Brandon Lee‚Äôs excellent performance (and his tragic death during the filming) would cement the film forever in cultural memory. Over the top and cynically campy, THE CROW was a cornerstone in the makings of many a queer identity, and we can‚Äôt wait to watch it with you on the big screen.

Remember, it can‚Äôt rain all the time. (Micheal Foulk)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Mask (1994)
show.headline: From zero to hero

event.title: <show-title>The Mask (1994)</show-title>
event.headline: ‚ÄúS-ssss-ssss-sssss-smokin'!‚Äù
event.description:
Men. YIKES. Throw a weird mask on a man? EVEN WORSE. Sorry. Let me start over. It‚Äôs part two of Queer Film Theory 101‚Äôs journey into the dark psyche of the '90s American male with the cartoonish and absurd 1994 classic THE MASK (all caps feel appropriate) staring one of our favorite fractured masculinity clowns, Jim Carrey, and featuring the amazing debut of Cameron Diaz. Just like a be-dragged Bugs Bunny seducing Elmer Fudd, THE MASK is surprisingly queer when you think about it. THE MASK is giving chaos bisexual by way of Tex Avery.

Stanly Ipkiss, a hapless bank employee and certified ‚Äúnice guy,‚Äù happens upon an ancient mask of indeterminant and likely problematically racist origin. When he pops it on his wormy little mug, he‚Äôs suddenly transformed into the uncomfortably horny anti-hero THE MASK! Is this new persona just the ticket that Stanley needs to assert himself and win the affection of the sultrily Jessica Rabbit-coded Tina? Or will the unbridled and violent masculinity of his new alter-ego cause him to lose everything‚Ä¶perhaps even his life?

Chuck Russell‚Äôs adaptation of Doug Mahnke and John Arcudi‚Äôs much darker Dark Horse Comic series became one of the top-grossing films of 1994. Due to the success of THE MASK, ACE VENTURA: PET DETECTIVE, and DUMB AND DUMBER (all released in 1994), Jim Carrey became a household name, and millions of children across the world became a little more annoying. C‚Äômon, you remember running around yelling, ‚ÄúSomebody stop me!‚Äù at anyone who would listen, right? What a nightmare. (Micheal Foulk)

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We‚Äôd love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! Kids (6+)
agePolicies.description: No children under the age of 6 will be admitted, and guests under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian over 21. Because of our food and alcohol service, parents and children under 18 must sit together and the parent must be present for the entire film.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard)
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.

agePolicies.name: Rated R
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
